original: khyed rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You should accept

translated: Those shapes are only shapeğŸ”½The shapes that are seen in a dream are only shape, not a form base that is separate from shape.

analyzed: 'gro ba dang dbyibs gnyis btags pa yod par khyad par med kyang /
translated: There is no difference in the imputed existence of both going and shape.

original: khyab pa ma yin pas 'gro ba bsal bas dbyibs kho na yongs su gzung ste /
analyzed: khyab pa ma yin pas 'gro ba bsal bas dbyibs kho na yongs su gzung ste /
translated: But since shape is not necessarily concomitant with going, shape alone is fully qualified because going is excluded.

analyzed: 'di ltar thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa g-yo ba med pas kyang go bar byed la /
translated: For example, shape is understood through the movement of hands and so on, even though they are not moving.

original: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems rig par byed pas kyang rnam par rig byed ces bya na /
analyzed: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems rig par byed pas kyang rnam par rig byed ces bya na /

translated: But even though hands and so on that are not generated in other places are not indicative form, they are known through the mind that motivates them.

original: de'i phyir khyab pas dbyibs kho na gzung gi 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab pas dbyibs kho na gzung gi 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore shape alone is fully qualified because it is concomitant with that mind, but going is not.

translated: This is asked because it is not tenable that shape is action, and it is not possible for it to be based on the body.

original: lus la brten pa'i las ni lus kyi las so zhes de ltar 'dogs kyi lus la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i las ni lus kyi las so zhes de ltar 'dogs kyi lus la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Bodily action is action that is based on the body. It is designated in that way, but it does not exist in the body.

original: lus la ni brten pa zhes bya ba ni lus la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: lus la ni brten pa zhes bya ba ni lus la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Based on the body means that it has the body as its object.

original: de yang lus 'jug par byed pa'i sems la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang lus 'jug par byed pa'i sems la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, it is asserted that it is the mind that engages the body.

original: dpyod pa dang bya ba'i sems pa gnyi ga lus la dmigs pa'i phyir ni dpyod pa'i sems pa gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bya ba'i sems pa gnyi ga lus la dmigs pa'i phyir ni dpyod pa'i sems pa gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since both the mind that investigates and the mind that acts have the body as their object, the mind that investigates is the mind that cuts.

original: de dang der lus 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½rab tu 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi las dag la yang ci rigs par zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the same way, verbal and mental action should be understood in the appropriate manner.

original: ngag la brten pa'i las ni ngag gi las te /
analyzed: ngag la brten pa'i las ni ngag gi las te /

original: ngag 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngag 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that causes speech to engage.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las so //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las so //
translated: Action associated with mind is mental action.

analyzed: de ltar na lus dang ngag gi ngag kyang yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i @9b phyir yid kyi las nyid du thal lo zhe na /

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /

original: zag pa med pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni /

analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir yid kyi las so zhes bya bar grub po //

analyzed: 'o na gang sems pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: 'dir lus dang ngag gis las ni sems pa kho na la bshad na /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //

analyzed: mdo sde pas gal te lus kyi las zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /

analyzed: gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed khas blang bar bya'o //

translated: Physical and verbal karma and that motivated by them are unwholesome due to motivation, not due to concomitant states, so they are like milk that comes from a cow fed unwholesome grain.
